title: Flight 93 National Memorial: Park Home
body: A common field one day.Â  A field of honor forever.  On Tuesday morning, September 11, 2001, the U.S. came under attack when four commercial airliners were hijacked and used to strike targets on the ground. Nearly 3,000 people tragically lost their lives. Because of the actions of the 40 passengers and crew aboard one of the planes, Flight 93, the attack on the U.S. Capitol was thwarted.                Visitor Center is Now Open   The Visitor Center opened on September 10, 2015.  Explore the different features of the memorial.        September 11 Observance   Explore details on this year's September 11 Observance              Become a Centennial Junior Ranger   Explore the special Centennial additions to the Junior Ranger program        Planning a Group Visit?   Explore the group visit page to help plan your visit.        A Sustainable and Green Visitor Center    Explore why the Visitor Center Complex is rated as LEED Gold building for sustainability.
